title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5901.8 - Regional organization criteria
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5901.8 - Regional organization criteria

State Regulations

The office shall evaluate the regional high technology
development organizational data included in the submitted proposal, based on
the following criteria and such additional criteria as set forth in the request
for proposals issued by the office: (a) the degree and completeness of information contained in the proposal; (b) the nature, relevance and importance of
the proposed activities to the region; (c) the anticipated economic benefits to the

State and the region to be derived from the proposed activities described in
the proposal; (d) the degree to
which the membership of the regional high technology development organization
is representative of the region's business, industry, labor, academic and
government sectors, including strong representation of the high technology
private sector; (e) the commitment
of time and energy of the principals of the regional high technology
development organization; (f) the
operational readiness of the regional high technology development organization
to carry out the activities described in the proposal; and
(g) the organization's prior experience and
demonstrated results in performing activities identical or similar to those
identified in the proposal. Notes

R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5901.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
